body:
I've got a couple ideas here:

1. There is a bug in our code that makes us forget or otherwise go back on which branch we decided
2. Some users have "privacy" settings that are even clearing indexeddb for add-ons. We don't have any explicit checks against this right now.
3. Firefox profiles are being copied after the Telemetry id has been created, but before this recipe ran. That would cause them to be sampled separately by Normandy. If it is possible to check the Normandy id, separate from the Telemetry id, you'd be able to confirm this.
body_text:
I've got a couple ideas here:

There is a bug in our code that makes us forget or otherwise go back on which branch we decided
Some users have "privacy" settings that are even clearing indexeddb for add-ons. We don't have any explicit checks against this right now.
Firefox profiles are being copied after the Telemetry id has been created, but before this recipe ran. That would cause them to be sampled separately by Normandy. If it is possible to check the Normandy id, separate from the Telemetry id, you'd be able to confirm this.
body_html:
I've got a couple ideas here:

  1. There is a bug in our code that makes us forget or otherwise go back on which branch we decided
  2. Some users have "privacy" settings that are even clearing indexeddb for add-ons. We don't have any explicit checks against this right now.
  3. Firefox profiles are being copied after the Telemetry id has been created, but before this recipe ran. That would cause them to be sampled separately by Normandy. If it is possible to check the Normandy id, separate from the Telemetry id, you'd be able to confirm this.
